item.title: Ian add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "I have a perfect cure for a sore throat: cut it." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Ian add a quote by Aki Shimizu
item.description: "Every lie contains truth, and every truth contains a lie" -- Aki Shimizu

item.title: Ian add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Ian add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "Always make the audience suffer as much as possible." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Ian add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "Ideas come from everything" -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Ian add a quote by Alfred Hitchcock
item.description: "Fear isn't so difficult to understand. After all, weren't we all frightened as children? Nothing has changed since Little Red Riding Hood faced the big bad wolf. What frightens us today is exactly the same sort of thing that frightened us yesterday. It's just a different wolf. This fright complex is rooted in every individual." -- Alfred Hitchcock

item.title: Ian add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Ian add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "For there is but one essential justice which cements society, and one law which establishes this justice. This law is right reason, which is the true rule of all commandments and prohibitions. Whoever neglects this law, whether written or unwritten, is necessarily unjust and wicked." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Ian add a quote by Cicero. M Tullius
item.description: "Times are bad. Children no longer obey their parents, and everyone is writing a book." -- Cicero. M Tullius

item.title: Ian add a quote by Trudi Canavan
item.description: "It is said, in Imardin, that the wind has a soul, and that it wails through the narrow streets because it is grieved by what it finds there." -- Trudi Canavan

item.title: Ian add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description:
"Now, five years is nothing in a man's life except when he is very young and very old...
- Wang Lung" -- Pearl S. Buck

item.title: Ian add a quote by Jonathan Stroud
item.description: "Freedom is an illusion. It always comes at a price." -- Jonathan Stroud

item.title: Ian add a quote by Nancy Farmer
Ian add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Guy don't need no sense to be a nice fella. Seems to me sometimes it jus' works the other way around. Take a real smart guy and he ain't hardly ever a nice fella." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ian add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Love is the foolishness of men, and the wisdom of God." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Ian add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "Freedom is a heavy load, a great and strange burden for the spirit to undertake. It is not easy. It is not a gift given, but a choice made, and the choice may be a hard one. The road goes upward towards the light; but the laden traveler may never reach the end of it." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Ian add a quote by Derek Landy
item.description: "You can only anticipate what someone is going to do if you know exactly what that someone has just done.' --Skulduggery" -- Derek Landy

item.title: Ian add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Ian add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "You can't help getting older, but you don't have to get old." -- George Burns

item.title: Ian add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ian add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James

item.title: Ian add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ian add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton

item.title: Ian add a quote by Vera Nazarian
item.description:
"It's a commonly expressed and rather nice, romantic notion that we are all "sisters" and "brothers."
Let's be real. Fact is, we might be better served to accept that we are all <i>siblings</i>.
Siblings fight, pull each other's hair, steal stuff, and accuse each other indiscriminately.
But siblings also know the undeniable fact that they are the same blood, share the same origins, and are family.
Even when they hate each other.
And that tends to put all things in perspective." -- Vera Nazarian

item.title: Ian add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Love, n. A temporary insanity curable by marriage." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Ian add a quote by Amy Sedaris
item.description: "I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are and to figure out why they are always alone." -- Amy Sedaris

item.title: Ian add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "Live not for Battles Won. Live not for The-End-of-the-Song. Live in the along." -- Gwendolyn Brooks

item.title: Ian add a quote by Thomas a Kempis
item.description:
"In omnibus requiem quaesivi, et nusquam inveni nisi in angulo cum libro.
<i>(Everywhere I have sought peace and not found it, except in a corner with a book.)</i>" -- Thomas a Kempis

item.title: Ian add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Ian add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had." -- Margaret Mead
